Sequence Information.Source: 69 short peptide collection ofOctopus bimaculoides, animals

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is poorly similar (43.33%) toGaegurin-RN4K: 20%, I: 16%, V=R: 12%.Activity: Active against Gram- bacteria E. coli 4 strains (MIC 3.125-6.25 ug/ml) and Gram+ S. aureus (reduced viability by 90%). It also aggregated E. coli (bacteria-agglutinating?).MOA:bacteria:E. coli: acted on bacterial membranes.Structure: random coil in buffer and helical in TFE (30%).In vitro toxicity: not toxic to mouse macrophage RAW 264.7 cells till 100 ug/ml.Other predicted peptides: four peptides predicted to be AMPs by online programs were synthesized and tested: three peptides showed MIC > 100 ug/ml and only this peptide is highly active.Entry history: AMP 2 (predicted) has been replaced. 12/2024
Literature Information.Author: Chen P, Zhang T, Li C, Praveen P, Parisi K, Beh C, Ding S, Wade JD, Hong Y, Li S, Nkoh JN, Hung A, Li W, Shang C. 2024
Literature Information.Title: Aggregation-prone antimicrobial peptides target gram-negative bacterial nucleic acids and protein synthesis.
